Sentencas: Hybrid direct carbon fuel cells (HDCFCs) are promising to achieve high power density, good fuel-electrode contact, and high carbon-fuel conversion efficiency due to increased reac-tion sites and hybrid routines of carbon utilization.
Titulo: A high-performance hybrid direct carbon fuel cell with tandem catalysis in the dendritic channeled anode

Sentencas: However, the performance of HDCFC is greatly restricted by mass transfer and detrimental carbon deposition.
Titulo: A high-performance hybrid direct carbon fuel cell with tandem catalysis in the dendritic channeled anode

Sentencas: The so-called CO-CO2 shuttle process, i. e., the coupling of the electrochemical reaction of CO to CO2 and subsequent discharge of CO2 towards the C fuel surface for gasification, is the key mass transfer process needed to be optimized.
Titulo: A high-performance hybrid direct carbon fuel cell with tandem catalysis in the dendritic channeled anode

Sentencas: This study demonstrates a novel high-performance HDCFCs anode by integrating C-gasification tandem catalysis in dendritic channel anode support (t-HDCFCs), which greatly enhances the CO-CO2 shuttle and mit-igates carbon deposition.
Titulo: A high-performance hybrid direct carbon fuel cell with tandem catalysis in the dendritic channeled anode

Sentencas: As a result, the t-HDCFC delivers a comparable or even higher electrochemical performance than the other HDCFCs under the same operation conditions, such as a peak power density of 556 mW cm-2 at 750 degrees C.(c) 2022 Hydrogen Energy Publications LLC.
Titulo: A high-performance hybrid direct carbon fuel cell with tandem catalysis in the dendritic channeled anode
